item.title: BD, Nepal map deeper trade, transit ties
item.description: The two-day 8th Bangladesh-Nepal commerce secretary level meeting (CSLM) concluded on Wednesday, focusing on deepening trade, transit and connectivity cooperation between the two neighbouring countries amid evolving regional and global trade dynamics. The meeting reviewed progress since the 7th CS

item.title: Venezuela’s Delcy vows to continue releasing prisoners detained under Maduro
item.description: Venezuela’s acting President Delcy Rodríguez said Wednesday her government would continue releasing prisoners detained under former President Nicolás Maduro’s rule in what she described as “a new political moment” since his ouster by the United States earlier t

item.title: Govt borrowing jumps 619pc
item.description: Bangladesh’s private sector risks a tightening credit environment as government borrowing from the banking system has surged to nearly Tk 600 billion in the first half of the current fiscal year, raising concerns about reduced lending capacity for businesses. According to Bangladesh Bank dat

item.title: Another crane collapses in Thailand killing 2 people
item.description: A crane collapsed in Thailand on Thursday, crushing two vehicles and killing two people, police said, a day after a crane accident in the northeast caused the deaths of 32 train passengers. The latest incident took place in Samut Sakhon province near the capital Bangkok, where a crane involved in

item.title: Hadi murder: Indictment hearing in court today
item.description: A Dhaka court will hold an indictment hearing on Thursday over the chargesheet submitted by the Detective Branch police in the murder case of Inquilab Moncho Convener Sharif Osman Bin Hadi. The hearing will be held in the court of Dhaka Additional Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Jashita Islam, says

item.title: BNP Chair Tarique to meet CA Yunus this evening
item.description: BNP Chariman Tarique Rahman is scheduled to meet with Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus on Thursday. The meeting will be held at the State Guest House Jamuna, the official residence of the chief adviser, according to a senior official in the Chief Adviser’s Office. The meeting between the head o

item.title: Players refuse to relent on BPL boycott as BCB president silent
item.description: Cricketers have remained firm in their decision to boycott Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) matches, despite the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) issuing a show-cause notice to Director M Nazmul Islam over recent disputes. One player, speaking on condition of anonymity, said: “It is upsetting

item.title: 185 of 203 polling centres in Khagrachhari identified as ‘risky’
item.description: Of the 203 polling centres in Khagrachhari, 185 have been identified as “risky”, with 63 of them classified as “highly risky”, says the district’s Election Officer SM Shahadat Hossain. The centres were identified based on observations by the police’s Special B

item.title: Hadi murder: Petitioner ‘dissatisfied’ with DB police chargesheet
item.description: The plaintiff in the murder case of Sharif Osman bin Hadi has expressed dissatisfaction with the charge sheet submitted by the Detective Branch (DB) of police, saying it fails to identify the main suspects or planners behind the killing. Inqilab Moncho Member Secretary Abdullah Al Jaber submitted

item.title: BNP delegation holds talks with CEC Nasir
item.description: A BNP delegation has sat for talks with Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin amid controversy surrounding postal ballots for the parliamentary election. The meeting began around 1:30 pm on Thursday at the Nirbachan Bhaban in Dhaka, Election Commission officials said. The talks are taking p

item.title: Jamaat-led 11-party alliance holds emergency meeting without Islami Andolan
item.description: The 11-party alliance led by Jamaat-e-Islami is holding an emergency meeting without the participation of Islami Andolan, a party that plans to leave the alliance if it does not get its expected seats and no consensus is reached on its key policies. item.title: Pabna-1, Pabna-2 polls to be held on Feb 12 under Sept 2025 boundaries
item.description: The Pabna-1 and Pabna-2 constituencies will go to the polls alongside the rest of the country during the 13th parliamentary election on February 12 with the revised boundaries set out by the Election Commission in its September, 2025 gazette.
